title: MUSTANG651
author: MUSTANG651
content: Hi guys.I just found new service with prepaid virtual crypto cards: https://www.paywide.io$300 minimal top up, no KYC.Anyone heard about it? Or maybe someone wants to test it?Sounds fishy, I know but still.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: I never heard of this website before even here on the forum it isn't mentioned here on the forum. I check it on Whois and look at the resultCode:Domain:paywide.ioRegistrar:GoDaddy.com, LLCRegistered On:2022-03-14Expires On:2023-03-14Updated On:2022-03-31It's 6 months old domain so it means it's a newly registered website with poor SEO and honestly, I can't even access the website it is not good to test the website I'm sure it's a scam better not to access the website to avoid any attacks in your IP.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: MUSTANG651 on September 06, 2022, 03:04:30 PMI just found new service with prepaid virtual crypto cards: https://www.paywide.io$300 minimal top up, no KYC.Anyone heard about it? Or maybe someone wants to test it?Sounds fishy, I know but still.No, and I won't test it because it can only be used with shitcoins and not with Bitcoin.  I know about other anonymous virtual cards, but this looks very suspicious because they claim there is no top-up amount limit.With very little information I would be very careful using any stuff like this, and never send more money than you are willing to lose.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: MUSTANG651 on September 06, 2022, 03:04:30 PM$300 minimal top up, no KYC.Keep in mind that, at least in EU, having no-KYC cards require the card total top-up, for the entire card lifetime, is somewhere around 250 EUR. So the minimum 300$ sounds fishy (and greedy).Of course, there can be done tricks like issuing the cards on others' names, but that is also risky, possibly illegal, and clearly overly expensive.

comments.author: MUSTANG651
comments.body: Quote from: dkbit98 on September 06, 2022, 03:26:58 PMother anonymous virtual cardsCan you suggest me a good one? I need it for small purchases online.I was using coindebit.io until it went to maintenance.As for PayWide I agree that's probably a scam.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Quote from: dkbit98 on September 06, 2022, 03:26:58 PMNo, and I won't test it because it can only be used with shitcoins and not with Bitcoin.  I know about other anonymous virtual cards, but this looks very suspicious because they claim there is no top-up amount limit.With very little information I would be very careful using any stuff like this, and never send more money than you are willing to lose.I don't think the site is functional to start with. Once I linked a wallet, they asked me to change the network, and when I did that, it logged me off.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: MUSTANG651 on September 06, 2022, 04:58:43 PMCan you suggest me a good one? I need it for small purchases online.I was using coindebit.io until it went to maintenance.No I don't know any other alternative anon cards that actually works, and I would just wait for Coindebit to come back with new cards.Only option you have now is to use some services that have giftcards for payment, but I am not going to recommend anything.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: MUSTANG651 on September 06, 2022, 04:58:43 PMCan you suggest me a good one?What exactly do you want to purchase online? Maybe we can find another way to buy on that site using Bitcoin or altcoin.There is one that I know alternative but I never tested it yet if you want then you can check this https://paywithmoon.com/It is also a Virtual card with No KYC the only problem is their card doesn't support Amazon and they are no longer active here on the forum but their social media accounts are active.You can try it for a small amount because it's a long ago that Paywithmoon worked well I don't know this time.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on September 06, 2022, 10:50:23 PMQuote from: MUSTANG651 on September 06, 2022, 04:58:43 PMCan you suggest me a good one?What exactly do you want to purchase online? Maybe we can find another way to buy on that site using Bitcoin or altcoin.-snip-There's EzzoCard but the prices are just way too high. It's not worth buying.Or, alternatively, and as BitMaxz mentioned, if you simply want to pay for something where the store doesn't accept bitcoin, or have gift cards, then you can maybe try Dashbargain.

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: Quote from: MUSTANG651 on September 06, 2022, 03:04:30 PMSounds fishy, I know but still.Definitely fishy. The support page only show most common/basic question and i couldn't find anything about the company from that website. I also find it's weird they Emphasizing NFT on their card type.Quote from: OmegaStarScream on September 07, 2022, 08:54:02 AM... or have gift cards, then you can maybe try Dashbargain.Could you share the link to Dashbargain? I wanted to take a look, but i only found non-HTTPS website from search engine result.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Quote from: ETFbitcoin on September 07, 2022, 11:49:41 AMCould you share the link to Dashbargain? I wanted to take a look, but i only found non-HTTPS website from search engine result.Apparently, that's the only version there is.They have an ANN thread in here[1] as well, but OP hasn't been around for quite some time so I'm not sure if they're still offering their services.[1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2138498.0

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on September 06, 2022, 10:50:23 PMThere is one that I know alternative but I never tested it yet if you want then you can check this https://paywithmoon.com/I think this cards work only in United States and for merchants located in US, there are a lot of other restrictions other than Amazon, you can't use them for any gambling or betting.It's better to carefully read their terms and faq page before signing up for anything. Quote from: OmegaStarScream on September 07, 2022, 08:54:02 AMOr, alternatively, and as BitMaxz mentioned, if you simply want to pay for something where the store doesn't accept bitcoin, or have gift cards, then you can maybe try Dashbargain.I heard about mobile wallet called Cake wallet that have CakePay option you can use for purchasing and using gift cards in your local area without any kyc.I didn't test this myself so I can't really confirm how it works in real life situations.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: I give up looking for a virtual card with crypto. Found some alternatives for limited uses like Payoneer. Although few sites offer a virtual card with KYC that can use crypto. But due to juridical restrictions, I am not qualified to get it. Most virtual card providers with the ridiculous condition are likely scams. I don't dare to use them or even visit them.

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: You can always go with https://www.coinsbee.com/en/payment-cards-bitcoin You can't refill and there are some limits but you can get cards that work in most parts of the world.The fees are a little high IMO but it's not the worst.coinsbee is active on the forum and they have been around for 3+ years so you don't have to worry about them taking your money and running.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5182163.0-Dave

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Quote from: DaveF on September 08, 2022, 04:53:56 PMYou can always go with https://www.coinsbee.com/en/payment-cards-bitcoin You can't refill and there are some limits but you can get cards that work in most parts of the world.The fees are a little high IMO but it's not the worst.-snip-You're probably referring to the old cards they used to provide (from PrepaidDigitalSolutions)?  They changed the supplier, the new cards require KYC as you can see on the bottom of the page: https://www.coinsbee.com/en/My%2BPrepaid%2BCenter%2BMastercard-bitcoin

comments.author: GxSTxV
comments.body: Quote from: MUSTANG651 on September 06, 2022, 03:04:30 PMHi guys.I just found new service with prepaid virtual crypto cards: https://www.paywide.io$300 minimal top up, no KYC.Anyone heard about it? Or maybe someone wants to test it?Sounds fishy, I know but still.Couldn't access their website unfortunately, probably my region is not allowed or it's a scam website that's already been shutdown. It's very hard to find a no KYC virtual card with cheap price due to worldwide bank rules and moneh Laundering.Better to stay away from them

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on September 08, 2022, 05:24:40 PMQuote from: DaveF on September 08, 2022, 04:53:56 PMYou can always go with https://www.coinsbee.com/en/payment-cards-bitcoin You can't refill and there are some limits but you can get cards that work in most parts of the world.The fees are a little high IMO but it's not the worst.-snip-You're probably referring to the old cards they used to provide (from PrepaidDigitalSolutions)?  They changed the supplier, the new cards require KYC as you can see on the bottom of the page: https://www.coinsbee.com/en/My%2BPrepaid%2BCenter%2BMastercard-bitcoinThe AMEX and Vanilla Visa do not require any KYC. But they seem to be region limited, and the rates are worse then the other cards that do need some form of KYC.I guess a lot comes back to location. I can get $100 Visa cards from Egifter for $105.99 but it's US only. I vaguely remember some provider in Canada having the same things with CAD value.Kind of funny since I can go to just about any convenience store / drug store / food store here in the US and get up to a $500 VISA / MC / AMEX gift card for cash and nobody gives a shit.....Order it online and get a free anal probe......-Dave

comments.author: MUSTANG651
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on September 06, 2022, 10:50:23 PMQuote from: MUSTANG651 on September 06, 2022, 04:58:43 PMCan you suggest me a good one?What exactly do you want to purchase online? Maybe we can find another way to buy on that site using Bitcoin or altcoin.Mainly for Google Play (their gift cards are scam) and sometimes LinkedIn sub for a month.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Quote from: MUSTANG651 on September 09, 2022, 02:20:21 PMMainly for Google Play (their gift cards are scam) and sometimes LinkedIn sub for a month.What do you mean their gift cards are a scam? You should be fine if you're buying them from a reputable provider. You can check this topic[1]. Just make sure you're buying the correct ones because IIRC, they are region locked.[1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5208530.0

comments.author: MUSTANG651
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on September 09, 2022, 04:22:14 PMthey are region locked.That's the problem. I can't activate them with the 2 VPNs that I have and I've heard people have issues with that even inside the country unless they're on mobile data.Sorry for the late answer.
